name: ImportProducts

properties.name: CustomPropertyTypes
properties.description: Custom properties used in product content can be defined by specifying their definition in this collection.

properties.name: CategoryID
properties.description: The ID of the category the property falls into. Defaults to `default`.

properties.name: DataType
properties.description: Defines the data type of the property.

properties.name: IndexType
properties.description: Defines whether and how the content of this property is searchable. Note that this is a flags enum so IndexType can both be IndexedNotAnalyzed and IndexedAnalyzed, meaning the field will be indexed in an analyzed *and* a non-analyzed manner.

properties.name: IsArray
properties.description: Determines if the property allows multiple values or if it's just a single value.

properties.name: ProductPropertyTypeID
properties.description: The ID of the custom property, by convention in snake_case.

properties.name: DownloadImagesInBackground
properties.description: When not specified, or explicitly specified as `false`, images will be downloaded while you wait and may cause this service to run for a long time. Defaults to `true`.

properties.name: ImageBlobCategory
properties.description: A string that identifies the category in which the ProductImages will be stored. It's optional, when not provided the SystemID will be used instead.

properties.name: LayerName
properties.description:
The layer on which the content will be stored. Defaults to 'ImportProducts-Base'. If you want to store the content on a different layer, you can specify it here. If the content also
specifies a language/country this will be combined with the provided layer name to create a layer name like '<name> <language> <country>', so the provided LayerName is not necessarily the absolute
value that is used for the layer, only if you leave LanguageID/CountryID as null on the content.

properties.name: Products
properties.description: The list of products to create or update. If a product does not exist it's created and if a product with the same ID and SystemID already exists it is updated.

properties.name: Assortments
properties.description: If specified this will add the product to those assortments.

properties.name: DeliveryOnly
properties.description: The product won't be available for endless aisle pickup from shop.

properties.name: DisableBackorder
properties.description: The product won't be orderable if there is no available stock.

properties.name: DisableDelivery
properties.description: The product will be unavailable for delivery.

properties.name: DisablePickup
properties.description: The product won't be available from a shop at all.

properties.name: NonSellable
properties.description: Indicates the product isn't sellable.

properties.name: PreRelease
properties.description: The product will be unavailable until the pre-order date.

properties.name: UseUp
properties.description: Indicates the product won't be back in store and all current stock is all there is going to be.

properties.name: Barcodes
properties.description: An (optional) list of barcodes for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

properties.name: Brand
properties.description: The (optional) brand of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

properties.name: CommodityCode
properties.description: The CommodityCode is used for customs declarations and product tariffs. Can be used to store the HS code of the product.

properties.name: Content
properties.description:
The per-language content of the product.

A small set of default properties has been defined, such as Name and MarketingDescription. Additional content can be defined inside `CustomContent`, which is a key-value container
where the key is the name of a property and value should be a single scalar value (string, number, boolean or null) or an array of values.

If LanguageID is left null, this will be the fallback content for languages that have no content of their own.
For example, you may offer a French website but you only have English product content, if you specify your English content with LanguageID = null
then products on the French website will have the English content.

In general, it's a good idea to choose a language that will serve as the default fallback language and to not specify LanguageID for that language's content so it will function as the fallback content.

properties.name: ID
properties.description: The unique identifier for the image. Optional, if null then an ID is generated based on the hash of the ImageUrl

properties.name: ImageData
properties.description: The raw image data. Only required if ImageUrl is left empty.

properties.name: ImageUrl
properties.description: Where can the image be downloaded? Required unless ImageData is provided.

properties.name: IsPrimaryImage
properties.description:
If an image is specified as IsPrimaryImage = true then it will be used as the primary image on the product.
If there is for some reason multiple images for a product that have IsPrimaryImage set to true then the last image that have this set will become the actual primary image.

properties.name: LocationType
properties.description: How the image should be stored. Usually empty.

properties.name: MimeType
properties.description: The image mime type. Optional, if null then the mime type will be guessed by the ImageUrl

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The human readable name of the image. Optional, if null then the name will be the ID of the image.

properties.name: Sequence
properties.description:
The sequence number of the image, can be used to determine the display order of images and will be used to determine the primary image of the product.

Smaller numbers mean a higher priority.

By default this will be null and the sequence of the images will be determined by their ordering in the Images array.

The number provided here does not necessarily translate to the actual sequence number stored in EVA, only the relative order will be used. Given the sequence 1, 2, 4, 7 the actual sequence stored in EVA
will be 0, 1, 2, 3.

properties.name: PublicationStatuses
properties.description: The publication status determines the visibility of the product. A product generally won't be visible to non-employee users unless it has publication status 'public'.

properties.name: CountryOfOriginID
properties.description: The country of origin for the product. Value must conform to the 2-letter country code as defined by ISO 3166-1.

properties.name: CustomID
properties.description: The custom identifier for the product.

properties.name: GiftCardConfigurationID
properties.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

properties.name: GiftCardData
properties.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines the optional data for configuration.

properties.name: GiftCardIsDigital
properties.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines if the product is digital, so it will not require a serialnumber during checkout.

properties.name: GiftCardType
properties.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

properties.name: ID
properties.description: The unique identifier for the product.

properties.name: IsDeleted
properties.description: Set to `True` to delete the product.

properties.name: LedgerClassID
properties.description: The (optional) ledger class ID of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

properties.name: ManufacturerID
properties.description: Optional field that can be used to store the manufacturer's identifier for this product.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The culture independent name of the product by which it can be recognized even if it otherwise does not have any content. Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

properties.name: ProductRequirements
properties.description: Optional field to set up the product requirements on a product.

properties.name: RequireSerialNumberForSale
properties.description: Optional field to indicate a serialnumber will be required when selling this product.

properties.name: SerialNumberConfigurationID
properties.description: Optional field to indicate what kind of serial number requirements apply to this product.

properties.name: Status
properties.description: Defines the status of a product.

properties.name: DeliveryOnly
properties.description: The product won't be available for endless aisle pickup from shop.

properties.name: DisableBackorder
properties.description: The product won't be orderable if there is no available stock.

properties.name: DisableDelivery
properties.description: The product will be unavailable for delivery.

properties.name: DisablePickup
properties.description: The product won't be available from a shop at all.

properties.name: NonSellable
properties.description: Indicates the product isn't sellable.

properties.name: PreRelease
properties.description: The product will be unavailable until the pre-order date.

properties.name: UseUp
properties.description: Indicates the product won't be back in store and all current stock is all there is going to be.

properties.name: TaxCode
properties.description:
The TaxCode determines how sales tax applies to this product. This must refer to an existing TaxCode in EVA, if it doesn't exist yet an error is returned.

Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

The string expected here is the Name property of the tax code, so 'High' for TaxCode High.

EVA defines the following default tax codes:

- High
- Intermediate
- Low
- Zero
- Exempt

In a hierarchy, the TaxCode only has to be specified for the root level; all products part of the hierarchy will always have the same TaxCode.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Defines what kind of product it is. If the product is part of a hierarchy, this is only relevant for the SKU level, all other levels will have type Configurable.

properties.name: AllowCustomPricing
properties.description: Indicates if custom pricing on the product is allowed.

properties.name: BundleProduct
properties.description: Indicates the product is of a bundle type.

properties.name: GiftCard
properties.description: A giftcard product.

properties.name: Insurance
properties.description: Indicates if the product is an insurance product.

properties.name: Service
properties.description: A non-physical product that represents a service of some sort.

properties.name: Stock
properties.description: A normal stock-keeping product. This will be the default if not specified.

properties.name: UnitBarcodes
properties.description: An (optional) list of barcodes with the associated quantity and unit of measure for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

properties.name: Barcode
properties.description: The barcode of the product. Must be unique.

properties.name: Quantity
properties.description: The quantity of the product (in the given unit of measure) that the barcode represents.

properties.name: UnitOfMeasureName
properties.description: The name of the unit of measure to use for this barcode. If not specified, 'Each' will be used. Must be created beforehand.

properties.name: VariationValues
properties.description:
Defines the per-language value of the variation property for this product. For example, if the variation property is `color` then the value could be 'red' or 'blue'.

If the variation value isn't language sensitive then the LanguageID should be left null. If there isn't an item where LanguageID is null, all languages for which this product has content must have
a value for the variation property.

properties.name: CountryID
properties.description: Can be left null if the variation value isn't culture dependent.

properties.name: LanguageID
properties.description: Can be left null if the variation value isn't culture dependent.

properties.name: Variations
properties.description: Defines the variations hierarchy of the product.

properties.name: LogicalLevel
properties.description:
The LogicalLevel of a product defines the 'level' on which the product can be thought to sit in the hierarchy.

For example, the various different colors of a shirt can be thought to have LogicalLevel = 'color' and the actual SKU might have LogicalLevel = 'size' or 'sku'.

You are free to use any value, but it's recommended to keep this consistent between all products, or at least between products of the same kind, as it's a useful way to
structure a frontend by for example filtering on the color level and only show sizes when navigating to the product detail.

properties.name: Products
properties.description: The actual variations of the product on the specified LogicalLevel.

properties.name: Property
properties.description: The property on which the product hierarchy varies. For example 'size' or 'color'.

properties.name: RootLogicalLevel
properties.description:
The LogicalLevel that will be assigned to the root level of a product hierarcy. If not specified a default value is used.

See ProductVariation.LogicalLevel for more information.

properties.name: SystemID
properties.description:
A string that identifies the system that was used to call this service. In combination with a product's ID, this is what uniquely identifies the product in EVA.
The SystemID must be the same for every call, if it's different from a previous call then new products will be created.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Determines the behavior of this service.

properties.name: WaitForProductComposition
properties.description:
By default this service only blocks for the time that it takes to store the requested modifications. After that time, some processing still needs to happen before the product is fully ready and searchable, but this happens in the background.
If this parameter is specified as true then this service blocks for the full duration that it takes to complete the full process.

properties.name: CreatedProductIDs
properties.description: The EVA IDs of the products that were newly created by this call.

properties.name: Code
properties.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

properties.name: RequestID
properties.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: A short description of the error type.

properties.name: ExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

properties.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
properties.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

properties.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

properties.name: PreviewResult
properties.description: If the Type of the request was PreviewOnly this property will contain the product structure that would be generated.

properties.name: ProductMap
properties.description: Contains an entry for every product mapping the input string ID to its internal EVA integer ID.

properties.name: UpdatedProductIDs
properties.description: The EVA IDs of the products were touched by this call.
